The fact: checker has rated the Facebook or Instagram post as "false", "altered", "partly false" or "missing context", indicating that the claim is being assessed for its accuracy.
Africa Check is a partner in Meta: s third-party fact-checking program, which aims to combat the spread of false information on social media. This partnership reinforces the credibility and reliability of the fact-checking process.
The content rated as: false" by Africa Check will be downgraded on Facebook and Instagram, reducing its visibility and reach. This action highlights the importance of verifying claims and preventing the dissemination of false information.
Africa Check is an independent: non-partisan organization that employs journalistic skills, online tools, readers, public sources, and experts to assess claims made in the public arena. Their commitment to sorting fact from fiction and publishing the results ensures the authenticity and accuracy of the claim being evaluated.
